references.paper_title: Neural message passing for Quantum chemistry
references.reason: This paper introduces the fundamental concept of Neural Message Passing for graph neural networks, which is crucial to the understanding of the architecture and the theoretical underpinnings of the work in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Semi-Supervised Classification with Graph Convolutional Networks
references.reason: This paper introduces the Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) architecture, which is a foundational model used extensively in graph neural networks and directly compared against in the target paper.
This paper introduces the Graph Attention Network (GAT) architecture, another important model in graph neural networks that is directly compared against in the target paper.

references.paper_title: How Powerful are Graph Neural Networks?
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical analysis of the expressive power of graph neural networks, which is relevant to the evaluation and understanding of limitations of the approach in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Hierarchical graph representation learning with differentiable pooling
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of hierarchical graph representation learning and differentiable pooling, which are relevant techniques used in graph neural networks and are discussed in relation to the proposed method in the target paper.
